title: gccgo: link error with text/template
body:
1. What is a short input program that triggers the error?

package main

import (
	"os"
	"text/template"
)

const tpl = "{{Â . }}\n"

func main() {
	t := template.Must(template.New("t").Parse(tpl))
	t.Execute(os.Stdout, "hello")
}

2. What is the full compiler output?

% gccgo -o main main.go
/tmp/ccOf8ZZe.o:main.go:function main.AN30_libgo_text_template$parse$item2e$hash: error:
undefined reference to 'libgo_text_template.parse.item$hash'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status

3. What version of the compiler are you using?  (Run it with the -V flag.)

% gccgo -v
Using built-in specs.
COLLECT_GCC=gccgo
COLLECT_LTO_WRAPPER=/opt/gccgo/libexec/gcc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/4.7.0/lto-wrapper
Target: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
Configured with: ../gccgo/configure --enable-languages=go --prefix=/opt/gccgo
--disable-bootstrap --with-ld=/usr/bin/ld.gold
Thread model: posix
gcc version 4.7.0 20120121 (experimental) (GCC)
